14
15#ifndef ISC_HEAP_H
16#define ISC_HEAP_H 1
17
18/*! \file isc/heap.h */
19
20#include <stdbool.h>
21
22#include <isc/lang.h>
23#include <isc/types.h>
24
25ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
26
27/*%
28 * The comparison function returns true if the first argument has
29 * higher priority than the second argument, and false otherwise.
30 */
31typedef bool (*isc_heapcompare_t)(void *, void *);
32
33/*%
34 * The index function allows the client of the heap to receive a callback
35 * when an item's index number changes. This allows it to maintain
36 * sync with its external state, but still delete itself, since deletions
37 * from the heap require the index be provided.
38 */
39typedef void (*isc_heapindex_t)(void *, unsigned int);
40
41/*%
42 * The heapaction function is used when iterating over the heap.
43 *
44 * NOTE: The heap structure CANNOT BE MODIFIED during the call to
45 * isc_heap_foreach().
46 */
47typedef void (*isc_heapaction_t)(void *, void *);
48
49typedef struct isc_heap isc_heap_t;
50
51isc_result_t
52isc_heap_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_heapcompare_t compare,
53 isc_heapindex_t index, unsigned int size_increment,
54 isc_heap_t **heapp);
55/*!<
56 * \brief Create a new heap. The heap is implemented using a space-efficient
57 * storage method. When the heap elements are deleted space is not freed
58 * but will be reused when new elements are inserted.
59 *
60 * Heap elements are indexed from 1.
61 *
62 * Requires:
63 *\li "mctx" is valid.
64 *\li "compare" is a function which takes two void * arguments and
65 * returns true if the first argument has a higher priority than
66 * the second, and false otherwise.
67 *\li "index" is a function which takes a void *, and an unsigned int
68 * argument. This function will be called whenever an element's
69 * index value changes, so it may continue to delete itself from the
70 * heap. This option may be NULL if this functionality is unneeded.
71 *\li "size_increment" is a hint about how large the heap should grow
72 * when resizing is needed. If this is 0, a default size will be
73 * used, which is currently 1024, allowing space for an additional 1024
74 * heap elements to be inserted before adding more space.
75 *\li "heapp" is not NULL, and "*heap" is NULL.
76 *
77 * Returns:
78 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS - success
79 *\li ISC_R_NOMEMORY - insufficient memory
80 */
81
82void
83isc_heap_destroy(isc_heap_t **heapp);
84/*!<
85 * \brief Destroys a heap.
86 *
87 * Requires:
88 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
89 */
90
91isc_result_t
92isc_heap_insert(isc_heap_t *heap, void *elt);
93/*!<
94 * \brief Inserts a new element into a heap.
95 *
96 * Requires:
97 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
98 */
99
100void
101isc_heap_delete(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int index);
102/*!<
103 * \brief Deletes an element from a heap, by element index.
104 *
105 * Requires:
106 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
107 *\li "index" is a valid element index, as provided by the "index" callback
108 * provided during heap creation.
109 */
110
111void
112isc_heap_increased(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int index);
113/*!<
114 * \brief Indicates to the heap that an element's priority has increased.
115 * This function MUST be called whenever an element has increased in priority.
116 *
117 * Requires:
118 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
119 *\li "index" is a valid element index, as provided by the "index" callback
120 * provided during heap creation.
121 */
122
123void
124isc_heap_decreased(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int index);
125/*!<
126 * \brief Indicates to the heap that an element's priority has decreased.
127 * This function MUST be called whenever an element has decreased in priority.
128 *
129 * Requires:
130 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
131 *\li "index" is a valid element index, as provided by the "index" callback
132 * provided during heap creation.
133 */
134
135void *
136isc_heap_element(isc_heap_t *heap, unsigned int index);
137/*!<
138 * \brief Returns the element for a specific element index.
139 *
140 * Requires:
141 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
142 *\li "index" is a valid element index, as provided by the "index" callback
143 * provided during heap creation.
144 *
145 * Returns:
146 *\li A pointer to the element for the element index.
147 */
148
149void
150isc_heap_foreach(isc_heap_t *heap, isc_heapaction_t action, void *uap);
151/*!<
152 * \brief Iterate over the heap, calling an action for each element. The
153 * order of iteration is not sorted.
154 *
155 * Requires:
156 *\li "heapp" is not NULL and "*heap" points to a valid isc_heap_t.
157 *\li "action" is not NULL, and is a function which takes two arguments.
158 * The first is a void *, representing the element, and the second is
159 * "uap" as provided to isc_heap_foreach.
160 *\li "uap" is a caller-provided argument, and may be NULL.
161 *
162 * Note:
163 *\li The heap structure CANNOT be modified during this iteration. The only
164 * safe function to call while iterating the heap is isc_heap_element().
165 */
166
167ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
168
169#endif /* ISC_HEAP_H */
170
